intro: Conyza minutiflora, commonly known as the smallflower weed, is an annual flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with slender, hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its small white or yellow flowers appear in clusters, often in late summer to early autumn. Conyza minutiflora is often found in disturbed soils and can be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
